summary: Borneo is the third-largest island globally, located in Southeast Asia. It is known as Kalimantan in Indonesian. The island is divided among three countries: Malaysia and Brunei in the north, and Indonesia in the south. With an area of 748,168 kmÂ², it is home to approximately 23 million people. Borneo is politically split, with Indonesia controlling the largest part (73%), Malaysia's states of Sabah and Sarawak making up 26%, and Brunei the remaining 1%. The island's unique position straddles both the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.
title: Borneo
